title: The Adoration of the Kings
description: De aanbidding der koningen. Links de heilige familie. Een van de koningen knielt en biedt een kelk met deksel aan, achter hem een knecht met een tulband met kroon. De twee andere koningen hebben kostbare metalen bekers in de hand.

principalMakers.name: Hendrick ter Brugghen
principalMakers.labelDesc: mentioned on object Hendrick ter Brugghen (c. 1588 - 01-nov-1629)

acquisition.creditLine: Purchased with the support of the Vereniging Rembrandt, the Prins Bernhard Fonds and the Stichting tot Bevordering van de Belangen van het Rijksmuseum

iconClassDescription: adoration of the kings: the Wise Men present their gifts to the Christ-child (gold, frankincense and myrrh)

longTitle: The Adoration of the Kings, Hendrick ter Brugghen, 1619
subTitle: h 132.5cm × w 160.5cm
scLabelLine: Hendrick ter Brugghen (1588-1629), oil on canvas, 1619

label.title: The Adoration of the Kings
label.makerLine: Hendrick ter Brugghen (1588-1629), oil on canvas, 1619
label.description:
The infant Christ sits on the lap of his mother, the Virgin Mary, while the three kings present him with gifts. It is striking that the figures are shown crowded together and in fairly stiff, static poses. Ter Brugghen’s style was old-fashioned by the standards of his time:
the bright palette recalls Mannerism. The realism, especially in the Child’s face, brings to mind the work of the Italian painter Caravaggio.
